shellcommand_test.comment: Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig; done' output Pattern Match '644' (string)

Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig; done' output Pattern Match '640' (string)

Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %U:%G /host/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig; done' output Equals 'root:root' (string)

Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done' output Pattern Match '644' (string)

Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done' output Pattern Match '640' (string)

Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %U:%G /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done' output Pattern Match 'root:root' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get clusterrolebindings -o=wide' output Pattern Match 'cluster-admin' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl auth can-i get,list,watch secrets --all-namespaces --as=system:authenticated' output Pattern Match 'no' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get roles --all-namespaces -o yaml' output Pattern Match '"*"' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get clusterroles -o yaml' output Pattern Match '"*"' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl auth can-i create pods --all-namespaces --as=system:authenticated' output Pattern Match 'no' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get serviceaccounts/default -o yaml' output Pattern Match 'automountServiceAccountToken.*false' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get serviceaccounts/$SERVICE_ACCOUNT -o yaml' output Pattern Match 'automountServiceAccountToken.*false' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get pods/$POD -o yaml' output Pattern Match 'automountServiceAccountToken.*false' (string)
Check for all pods where any container has the securityContext.privileged flag set to true.
Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the hostPID flag set to true
Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the hostIPC flag set to true
Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the hostNetwork flag set to true
Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the spec.allowPrivilegeEscalation flag set to true
AZ command to check for CNI plugin is not set to kubenet
Ensure 'az aks show --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --query "networkProfile"' output Pattern Match 'networkPolicy.*azure' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --query "networkProfile"' output Pattern Match 'networkPolicy.*calico' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get all -o jsonpath='{range .items[?(@..secretKeyRef)]} {.kind} {.metadata.name} {"\n"}{end}' -A' output Pattern Not Match '" "' (string)
Command to list and check for objects in default namespace
Check Azure Defender Plan for Container Registries are enabled
Ensure 'az security pricing list --query "[?type=='Microsoft.ContainerRegistry/registries'].{Name:name, Status:properties.status}" -o table' output Pattern Match 'enabled=true' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --query "apiServerAccessProfile.enablePublicFqdn"' output Pattern Match 'true' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --query "apiServerAccessProfile.enablePrivateCluster"' output Pattern Match 'true' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --query "apiServerAccessProfile.enablePublicFqdn"' output Pattern Match 'false' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --query "apiServerAccessProfile.enablePrivateCluster"' output Pattern Match 'true' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --query "apiServerAccessProfile.enablePrivateCluster"' output Pattern Match 'true' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --query "networkProfile.networkPolicy"' output Pattern Match 'calico' (string)
Ensure 'az aks show --name ${CLUSTER_NAME} --resource-group ${RESOURCE_GROUP} --query "networkProfile.networkPolicy"' output Pattern Match 'azure' (string)

process58_test.comment: Ensure that the --read-only-port argument is set to 0

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure at least one file named /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf exists and matches pattern ^.*KUBELET_SYSTEM_PODS_ARGS.+--read-only-port=0.+$

shellcommand_object.comment: Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig; done' output Pattern Match '644' (string)

shellcommand_object.command: for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig; done

shellcommand_object.comment: Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %U:%G /host/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig; done' output Equals 'root:root' (string)
shellcommand_object.command: for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %U:%G /host/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig; done

shellcommand_object.comment: Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done' output Pattern Match '644' (string)
shellcommand_object.command: for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done

shellcommand_object.comment: Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done' output Pattern Match '640' (string)
shellcommand_object.command: for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %a /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done

shellcommand_object.comment: Ensure 'for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %U:%G /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done' output Pattern Match 'root:root' (string)
shellcommand_object.command: for node in $(kubectl get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do kubectl exec -it file-check -- stat -c %U:%G /host/etc/kubernetes/azure.json; done

shellcommand_object.comment: Ensure 'kubectl get clusterrolebindings -o=wide' output Pattern Match 'cluster-admin' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl auth can-i get,list,watch secrets --all-namespaces --as=system:authenticated' output Pattern Match 'no' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get roles --all-namespaces -o yaml' output Pattern Match '"*"' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get clusterroles -o yaml' output Pattern Match '"*"' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl auth can-i create pods --all-namespaces --as=system:authenticated' output Pattern Match 'no' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get serviceaccounts/default -o yaml' output Pattern Match 'automountServiceAccountToken.*false' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get serviceaccounts/$SERVICE_ACCOUNT -o yaml' output Pattern Match 'automountServiceAccountToken.*false' (string)
Ensure 'kubectl get pods/$POD -o yaml' output Pattern Match 'automountServiceAccountToken.*false' (string)
Check for all pods where any container has the securityContext.privileged flag set to true.
shellcommand_object.command: kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r '.items[] | select(.spec.containers[].securityContext.privileged == true) | select(.metadata.namespace != "kube-system" and .metadata.namespace != "gatekeeper-system" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-arc" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-extensions-usage-system") | "\(.metadata.name) \(.metadata.namespace)"'

shellcommand_object.comment: Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the hostPID flag set to true
shellcommand_object.command: kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r '.items[] | select(.spec.hostPID == true) | select(.metadata.namespace != "kube-system" and .metadata.namespace != "gatekeeper-system" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-arc" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-extensions-usage-system") | "\(.metadata.name) \(.metadata.namespace)"'

shellcommand_object.comment: Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the hostIPC flag set to true
shellcommand_object.command: kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r '.items[] | select(.spec.hostIPC == true) | select(.metadata.namespace != "kube-system" and .metadata.namespace != "gatekeeper-system" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-arc" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-extensions-usage-system") | "\(.metadata.name) \(.metadata.namespace)"'

shellcommand_object.comment: Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the hostNetwork flag set to true
shellcommand_object.command: kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r '.items[] | select(.spec.hostNetwork == true) | select(.metadata.namespace != "kube-system" and .metadata.namespace != "gatekeeper-system" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-arc" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-extensions-usage-system") | "\(.metadata.name) \(.metadata.namespace)"'

shellcommand_object.comment: Command retrieves all pods across all namespaces in JSON format, then uses jq to filter out those with the spec.allowPrivilegeEscalation flag set to true
shellcommand_object.command: kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r '.items[] | select(any(.spec.containers[]; .securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation == true)) | select(.metadata.namespace != "kube-system" and .metadata.namespace != "gatekeeper-system" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-arc" and .metadata.namespace != "azure-extensions-usage-system") | "\(.metadata.name) \(.metadata.namespace)"'
